BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
In the Function Structure Navigator it is not currently possible to change the status of an item or figure from the currently assigned values.

The specification DHC-622 the requirement was  stated to be modified manually. This was put in place to allow manual update of the data in the short term.

This issue was initially raise as INC0013955 on July 13, 2022. Prior to go live the functionality was tested as working correctly in the Pre-Prod environment.

Title__c: The Figure Preview Report does not display the Functional Document part information when it is prese
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c: This case was tested with Model 400 Figure 32311601 item 001, and the data for the Functional Documents was confirmed as present in the Function Structure Navigator. A review of the test cases from development showed that the Functional Documents were pr
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
This case was tested with Model 400 Figure 32311601 item 001, and the data for the Functional Documents was confirmed as present in the Function Structure Navigator. A review of the test cases from development showed that the Functional Documents were present in the Figure Preview Report prior to go live of IFS.

The requirement for the Functional Documents to be in the Figure Preview Report is documented in the specification "DHC-852 - IPC Figure Preview and Print."

This "change" was part of the original agreed specified go live minimum requirements and was not delivered.

This issue was originally raised under INC0013920 July 12th, 2022.

Title__c: Illustrated Parts Catalog Workbench Figure Status Report Enhancement
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c:
The use case for this (from the IPC side) is for a supervisor or other user to determine if all data is ready for publication.

This will mean that the user will wish to filter out all "Dummy Figure" types or select Figure or Item or Figure and Item typ
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
The use case for this (from the IPC side) is for a supervisor or other user to determine if all data is ready for publication.

This will mean that the user will wish to filter out all "Dummy Figure" types or select Figure or Item or Figure and Item types. With this done the user would either need to select "Created" and "In Revision" or exclude "Official" and "Released." It would also be desirable to be able to select and exclude the status values individually.

This request originally raised in JIRA  DHC-2809 on June 2, 2022 and was re-created as RITM0011989 on June 22nd, 2022.

Title__c: Investigate IFS Change Request Scope, Cost, Timeline and Effort - Jeff Oberlin
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c: In order to fix this IFS "serialization" issue we need Hoist to run a series of scripts to correct the parts master data in IFS. The ERP Remediation Program team has been working on this project for a while and the requirements document is now complete.
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
In order to fix this IFS "serialization" issue we need Hoist to run a series of scripts to correct the parts master data in IFS. The ERP Remediation Program team has been working on this project for a while and the requirements document is now complete. Chris Schnitzler and Jeff Oberlin are the ones who will own the IFS Request for Change submittal. 

1. There is no way for a user to manually swap a part marked as serialized in IFS to non-serialized in IFS – this is why we need a script (the reason this feature isn't offered in ERPs is because you don't want anyone going in and changing critical master data at the flip of switch because it could really impact your business)

2. Parts records are tied to information in IFS that pertains to items in stock, on PO, customer orders, non-stocked items and expiry dates/pricing info etc. 

So the script needs to be carefully written to ensure this data doesn't get mixed up. We need to ensure the script changes the right data and doesn't impact anything else or it could cause havoc in our prod environment. 

For example -  when parts records are added, we program an expiry date or shelf life per part, when the part records are updated we need to ensure the expiry dates do not change. We need to be sure that parts allocated to orders remain allocated to those orders, we need to ensure that pricing info etc. also remains accurate. 

3. In order to ensure the script addresses the most current data set, there will need to be an outage on the system where we take a snapshot of the info and then immediately run the corrections in test and if ok move to prod. 

This cannot be done while anyone is using the system because when the data pulled is used to build the script, if anyone is using IFS that data will no longer be accurate and so the script may fail. 
It is likely that customer orders being fed through the portal or aeroxchange will also need to be part of the outage for this same reason. 

4.  There could be manual work the warehouse colleagues need to do after the script is done to tie up loose ends and ensure nothing has been compromised. 

The good thing is that once this is done, those records will be correct and we can clear about 150K of backlog that's held up right now due to this issue. Also, if we manage to correct the data it will only need to be done once. About 6000 of the 250K parts records are affected by this issue and it was caused by the import of data from SAP into IFS not transitioning properly.

records.BMCServiceDesk__description__c: Email Sent-Incident #00007678 (Ref:IN:00007678)
records.BMCServiceDesk__note__c:
From: incident@hgts.tech
Sent: Thu, Jan 19, 2023 09:03 AM
To: richard.cormier@sbxtechnologies.com;
Cc: mohamed.ajmal@hoist.tech;
Subject: Incident #00007678 (Ref:IN:00007678)

Hi Chris/Jeff/Paul
 
 We have investigated the request that you have sent us last week. Change serialized parts to non-serialized parts. Change non-serialized parts to serialized parts. 
 Change serialized parts to non-serialized parts.
 
 Our suggestion is to change the “Part No” of the affected part in the “Part Serial” window. With this action, connections to the “Inventory Transactions History” will be removed and ‘New Part Number’ will be continued. 
 After removing this connection, it will be possible to change serialized parts to non-serialized parts. ‘Original part number’ will be continued for the future orders. Script can be provided to proceed with this proposal. 
   Original Part number New Part number 1140-0122-5 1140-0122-5-A 
 Concerns No hiostory record will be maintanied for the past inventory movements for this particular “Part No”. as the New part number will be reffered for the history record. CO Reservations should be removed. Shop orders should be removed All the inventoy records needed to be ‘0’ before proceeding. 
 Change non-serialized parts to serialized parts.
 
 Once the inventory and the resvations has been removed non- serialized parts can be changed to serialized parts without any data repairs. 
 
 There can be other issues as well. Therefore, Thorow testing needed to be done from the customer before proceeding to the Production.
 Please advise a time that we can have a call regarding the same. 
 
 BR, Danuka

Title__c: Change specification for Core at customer report
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c:
Reference to incident No INC0018073. 

This request is to adjust the original specification of the IFS report "DHC_1057: DCS Core Credit JV Upload "

This report is used part of the month end activity to book /recognize the cost of Core inventory at c
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
Reference to incident No INC0018073. 

This request is to adjust the original specification of the IFS report "DHC_1057: DCS Core Credit JV Upload "

This report is used part of the month end activity to book /recognize the cost of Core inventory at customer. IFS has a limitation to calculate and book these transaction automatically based on inventory transaction movement. Therefore, a report was created on IFS development stage to generate a transaction list of Inventory Core transaction/orders when Core not received back from customer.

The modification required on the report are:
1- To exclude the cancelled CRO transaction to appears from the report.
2-To exclude the CRO orders which has been returned to our WH/inventory by RMA transaction ( returned material authorization)
3-Scrapped Core inventory/orders at customers location.

Materiality of the deviation:- 

October 2022 Month end report was showing 6.1M, but actual Inventory of Core at customer value to be booked based on the report is only 4.1M due to the incorrect transaction showing in the report which doesn't represent actual Core inventory balance at customer.

This request raised based on the confirmation from Hoist that change request to be raised to correct the report specification.( Attached)

Thanks,
Bahaa

Title__c: When Part Interchangeability is Updated, change the date on field cf_date_change
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c: When Part Interchangeability is updated in IFS, the change is not reflected in IFS.  (Only new IFS interchangeability entries are reflected on the portal today).  This was discovered on DevOps 1285 for part number MS28884A4 Valve, Check when interchangea
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
When Part Interchangeability is updated in IFS, the change is not reflected in IFS.  (Only new IFS interchangeability entries are reflected on the portal today).  This was discovered on DevOps 1285 for part number MS28884A4 Valve, Check when interchangeability was removed in IFS and it still shows on the portal and is visible to the customer.

In a problem solving session with Deepak, Gavin, Rahul, Teresa and Heather (January 2023), the recommended option is to use
LU:  CPartInterchange
Field: CF_DATE_CHANGE
to record any update to the Custom Part Interchangeability table because the Field:  CF_DATE_CHANGE is already part of the OPO to IFS API interface.

Two other options were considered and discarded:
a)  Use the History Log, however there is no rest API for this
b)  Create an event for oracle, however, not as efficient as the proposed solution

The workaround hack is to change the part number and then change it back.  However, this is a high risk option prone to error.  So far we have only discovered one case, but it is difficult to detect if there are other examples.

BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c: Setup object connections with Non-Conformance Reports with inbound receiving transactions such as CRO Exchanges (for cores being returned by DCS customer , Return material authorizations (for return unused Material).  This is configurable by an IFS admin
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c: Setup object connections with Non-Conformance Reports with inbound receiving transactions such as CRO Exchanges (for cores being returned by DCS customer , Return material authorizations (for return unused Material).  This is configurable by an IFS administrator (as documented in the IFS development guide (Foundation1 / Administration Guide / User Interface / Object Connections / ).  Purchase Order Line Part is the sole object that is already configured.

Title__c: Investigate IFS Change Request Scope, Cost, Timeline and Effort - Melanie Litoski

Title__c: Investigate IFS Change Request Scope, Cost, Timeline and Effort - Heather Will
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c: In PREPROD we made the field "Customer's PO Number" mandatory after getting cross functional agreement, but are getting errors when testing for the DCS program impact when using order types SRV and SRO.  Therefore we are going through the change board to
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
In PREPROD we made the field "Customer's PO Number" mandatory after getting cross functional agreement, but are getting errors when testing for the DCS program impact when using order types SRV and SRO.  Therefore we are going through the change board to get additional support.  Then our data steward can make the field mandatory in PROD.

We do not know how to add the data validation to forbid blanks at the beginning or end of the field

records.BMCServiceDesk__description__c: Notes
records.BMCServiceDesk__note__c:
Hi @Heather Will,

We can add a Validation via a custom event so that an error will get triggered if there are blanks in the Customer PO Number.

Thanks and Regards,
Prabhavi.

Title__c: Hi, Every month I'm getting a negative cost on DCS program against Receipt of P
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c: Hi, Every month I'm getting a negative cost on DCS program against Receipt of Purchase Order which I failed to understand the  accounting treatments for this type of transaction. so please have a look at the attached sample for Feb and advise the account
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
Hi, Every month I'm getting a negative cost on DCS program against Receipt of Purchase Order which I failed to understand the  accounting treatments for this type of transaction. so please have a look at the attached sample for Feb and advise the accounting treatment, how and why we are getting negative cost when PO is arrived? when its get cleared? If this negative balance to be cleared when invoices processed, then how can I reconciled this? please share the clear documentation for the process.

On the other side, I'm getting on a monthly basis a huge negative cost from Received Part to Repair in CRO transaction. this is related to the Core return which is always higher than value of parts shipped to the customer. We are currently testing the Core pricing on IFS if its overstated, but do you think any other accounting reasons are effecting this regular negative balances. Appreciate if you can get back to me before month end to justify the continuous negative cost from the above two transactions.

Hi Alina,

Today, at IPL St-Damien , a new situation happenned about the ‘'Component Shortage Report’'.

  *   The Shop order at status ‘' Issued’' are not part of the condition rules of the report.

  *   Procurement team Discover the shop orders ''Issued are not only shops orders with problem.

  *   Shop orders under status ‘'Issued’' are shop order in production process the first pallet of finish goods have been scanned.

  *   Based under this information Procurement Team need ‘shop order at Status ‘’ Issued’' taken under the condition.



Exemple of the problem:

Part 1010029 should have been listed under the ‘'Component Shortage Report’' of 2023-06-06 :

[cid:csg-icon-genericAttachment]Attached file
[cid:59772d37-ff00-4416-ab2f-42850850e275]
[cid:csg-icon-genericAttachment]Attached file



Sumarized: Please add condition ‘' Shop order at status ‘' Issued’'’' to the condition of the report.

This will be an addition of the other add requested previously under this jira.

If you have any question, let us know

Merci

Stephane

records.BMCServiceDesk__description__c: Email Sent-Incident #00009824 -  DHC - Background Jobs - Update quote sales info  (Ref:IN:00009824)
records.BMCServiceDesk__note__c:
From: incident@hgts.tech
Sent: Thu, Mar 16, 2023 10:46 AM
To: gavin.hall@hoist.tech;
Subject: Incident #00009824 -  DHC - Background Jobs - Update quote sales info  (Ref:IN:00009824)

Hi Gavin,

It looks like the system tries to insert a null record in which case, following data is not available.
COMPANY_ = 1000
SQ_NO_ = C36338
CUSTOMER_ID_ = 44177 

I couldn't find those data in TEST environment with IFSSUPP user.
Can you please check whther this data is available through SERVICE.B2B user?

a solution i see here is to validate the custom package method C_Available_Credit_Update_API.Set_Sq_Available_Credit_Amount not to insert if there's null values.

Best regards,
​​​​​​​Dayadra.


Link to view record as Remedyforce user: https://hgts--bmcservicedesk.vf.force.com/?startURL=%2Fone%2Fone.app%23%2FalohaRedirect%2Fapex%2FBMCServiceDesk__RemedyforceConsole%3Frecord_id%3Da1T8W000005a8YUUAY%26objectName%3DIncident__c

(Ref:IN:00009824)

Best Regards,
Poornima Maduwanthi

Error message screenshot with text pasted below:


Error while serializing contents.

This error happens when the s
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
Hello Support,

Shiva Agarwal is receiving the below error when filtering customer invoices data for specific customers in IFS.


Error message screenshot with text pasted below:


Error while serializing contents.

This error happens when the server cannot serialize the data to be sent to the client.

A common cause is that one attribute's length exceeds the defined maxlength in the projection.

To find more info, open Log Window or Debug Console, refresh and then check Network Tab in DevTools. In the response there can be more detailed information about the exception.

records.BMCServiceDesk__note__c:
Hi @Shiva Agarwal,

As per the investigations we believe that there must be an issue regarding to the basic data setup for this particular customer "44275".
We suggest, it's better to check basic data setup in customer's address setup for this customer. In meantime could you please send us another sample customer ID's which has the same issue to investigate further.

As a workaround you can remove both "Invoice Address "and "Customer Reference"  columns from the table view or list view. Then you can view the customer invoice data for this particular customer "44275".
Please see the attached document "Error when Filtering IFS Invoices" which describes the workaround solution.

Best Regards,
Harsha Jayasuriya.
